docs.lead_paragraph: An unnatural chill enshrouds this rough-hewn little town on the eastern edge of the Navajo Indian Reservation, a chill unexplained by the weakened January sun or the snow on the mesas. The Navajo majority and the small Anglo population are suddenly linked by fear. The intense fear has been touched off by a series of violent incidents in the last six weeks, reaching a peak last weekend in a kidnapping and murder. Now there is talk of pulling up stakes, of carrying firearms, of the dangers of vigilante action.

headline.main: ATTACKS TOUCH OFF FEAR AT NAVAJO RESERVATION
